bug.author: Zylatis
bug.description: A report i generate from a csv gives some columns has having large numbers of missing values and a very small number of zeroes. In fact, in generating this data i use fillna(0) to get rid of the missing data, so i suspect there is an issue with it interpreting 0 as missing data. I tried using fillna(0.0) instead, no bueno. Is there some heuristic at play here to determine if/when 0's are actually missing? Thanks! Z

comments.comment:
Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Zylatis>@Zylatis</denchmark-link> , I've made a test that tries to reproduce the scenario you have described. With the basic setup below, the code works as expected, muy bueno. I'm curious in what way this synthetic dataset differs from your setup. Can you try to identify the key differences between both setups? """ Test for issue 213: https://github.com/pandas-profiling/pandas-profiling/issues/213 """ import pandas as pd import pandas_profiling import numpy as np
def test_issue213(): b = np.ones((1000000)) b[10:-10] = np.nan df = pd.DataFrame(b, columns=['vals'])
df.profile_report().to_file('test_missing.html')
df.fillna(0, inplace=True)
df.profile_report().to_file('test_filled.html')
